SEARCH
Package copy_directory

Class CopyDirectory

java.lang.Object
copy_directory.CopyDirectory
public class CopyDirectory extends Object

CopyDirectory

The CopyDirectory is the main class of this program. In its execution, it interacts with the user through JOptionPane panels with the objective of copy and paste files/paths.

With special emphasis, much of the knowledge used here was taken from chapter 2 of the book Core Java II (tenth edition) by Cay S. Horstmann.

  • Constructor Details

    • CopyDirectory

      public CopyDirectory()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

      Main Method

      This program question the user in your init with two JOptionPane.showInputDialog(java.awt.Component, Object, String, int) that resquest the values of the copyString and pasteString and his respectives paths (copyPath and pastePath). Then it will create a StringBuilder named sbLog that receive all logs of this copy, like the init time, all files copied and pasted and, the end time.

      To prevent an infinite recursion error, caused when the pastePath is inside the copyPath, this program then checks for the existence of this possible error in a try block. First is stored in two String objects the absolute path of copyPath and pastePath. Then verify if absPastePath contains absCopyPath with the method String.contains(CharSequence). If it is true, is throwed a new InputMismatchException(String), that receive in the String parameter a detail message that explains the error. Then, in the catch block, is showed a JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(java.awt.Component, Object, String, int) that warns of the error and terminate the program with a System.exit(int) as parameter -1 to indicates unsuccessful termination with Exception.

      With the Files.walk(Path, java.nio.file.FileVisitOption...) that returs a Stream of Path, this program will try traverse this Stream<Path> with a Stream.forEach(Consumer). As this Consumer is passed a lambda with the parameter p of type Path and int the body the process of copy and paste.

      Into the body of the consumer, the program will try create a Path named q that receive the pastePath.resolve(copyPath.relativize(p)). Then print what file is being copied and what file is being pasted. Next, test with the Files.isDirectory(Path, java.nio.file.LinkOption...) if p (the path being copied) is a directory, if the test is true, is created the directory q (the path being pasted) with the method Files.createDirectory(Path, java.nio.file.attribute.FileAttribute...); else the file on the path p is copied to the path q with the method Files.copy(Path, Path, java.nio.file.CopyOption...).

      After the scope of the try that contains the Files.walk(Path, java.nio.file.FileVisitOption...) is terminated and processed the log, finally it is writed.

      Finally is showed in a JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(java.awt.Component, Object, String, int) a message notifying the finish of the copy from copyPath to pasteString.

      Parameters:
      args - aren't used in this program.
